titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Undergraduate Admissions, Yale University, Records of the Dean
Undergraduate Admissions, Yale University, Records of the Dean
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:16

did.unittitle: Undergraduate Admissions, Yale University, records of the dean

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, memoranda, surveys, reports and student files documenting the activities and operations of the Yale Office of Undergraduate Admissions.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of Undergraduate Admissions

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 11-A (YRG 11-A), Records of offices responsible for Yale undergraduate admissions and financial aid programs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Undergraduate Admissions, Yale University, Records of the Dean (RU 818). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, memoranda, surveys, reports and student files documenting the activities and operations of the Yale Office of Undergraduate Admissions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.
